page.title: 12ASTLEY BRIDGE FARM (1)
page.content: The Calcutt's have farmed at Astley Bridge for the past 22 years.They have owned it longest of all the farms to be found around Merton.Some of their land is very good because it has been drained by putting pipes under the fields.This was finished about 10years ago and should last for 100years.The fields used to be ridge and furrow.One or two of these have been retained for conservation purposes and these contain many wildflowers including orchids.The River Ray flows through the farm and sometimes floods the fields near its banks.Machines used on the farm include combine harvesters,ploughs and 3 tractors.They also possess are large corn dryer so that when it is time to sell the wheat they grow it is very clean,dry and at its best.
